info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 3:59AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...SLIPPERY CONDITIONS POSSIBLE THROUGH 10 AM THIS MORNING IN THE NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS NEAR THE TENNESSEE BORDER... Very light precipitation is expected to continue across the western North Carolina mountains in locations near the Tennessee border through 10 am EST. Coverage of the spotty, light precipitation may expand slightly through the early morning hours. With temperatures falling into the 20s, a mixture of snow, sleet, and freezing rain is possible. This could lead to very slippery surfaces, especially on elevated structures such as bridges and decks. Use caution if traveling overnight into Monday morning. Allow extra travel time and stopping distance. Reduce your speed and be on the lookout for ice-covered surfaces.
